p: Whilst these principles provide an excellent basis to build upon, health adaptation must carry out these functions with relative uncertainty about the future [ 12•]. Public health already manages the projection of future health risks, such as disease outbreaks; however, these risks occur within relatively predictable and often previously observed boundaries. This added uncertainty necessitates the need for public health practitioners to engage with new expertise—such as climatologists—to better understand the future risks and to inform planned responses.
